Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: We made it. I guess I was wrong, there was no danger at all.

Speaker: cord
Dialogue: ... I'm sorry, m'lady... I'm... not sure I...

Speaker: amidala
Dialogue: I should not have come back.

Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: M'Lady, you are still in danger.

Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: This vote is very important. You did your duty and Cord did hers. Now come.  M'Lady, please!

Speaker: mas amedda
Dialogue: Order! We shall have order! The motion for the Republic to commission an army takes precedent, and that is what we will vote on at this time.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: ...My esteemed colleagues, excuse me... I have just received some tragic and disturbing news. Senator Amidala of the Naboo system... Has been assassinated!

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: This grievous blow is especially personal to me. Before I became Chancellor, I served Amidala when she was Queen. She was a great leader who fought for justice, not only in this honourable assembly, but also on her home planet. She was so loved she could have been elected queen for life. She believed in public service, and she fervently believed in democracy. Her death is a great loss to us all. We will all mourn her as a relentless champion of freedom... and as a dear friend.

Speaker: ambassador darsana
Dialogue: Why weren't the Jedi able to stop this assassination? We are no longer safe, under their protection.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Must I remind the Senator from Malastare that negotiations are continuing with the separatists. Peace is our objective here... not war.

Speaker: amidala
Dialogue: My noble colleagues, I concur with the Supreme Chancellor. At all costs, we do not want war!

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: It is with great surprise and joy the chair recognises the Senator from Naboo, Padm Amidala.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Less than an hour ago, an assassination attempt was made against my life. One of my bodyguards and six  others were ruthlessly and senselessly murdered. I was the target but, more importantly, I believe this security measure before you, was the target. I have led the opposition to build an army... but there is someone in this body who will stop at nothing to assure it's passage...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I warn you, if you vote to create this army, war will follow. I have experienced the misery of war first-hand; I do not wish to do it again.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Wake up, Senators... you must wake up! If you offer the separatists violence, they can only show us violence in return! Many will lose their lives. All will lose their freedom. This decision could very well destroy the very foundation of our great Republic. I pray you do not let fear push you into a disastrous decision. Vote down this security measure, which is nothing less than a declaration of war! Does anyone here want that? I cannot believe they do.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Due to the lateness of the hour and the seriousness of this motion, we will take up these matters tomorrow. Until then, the Senate stands adjourned.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: I don't know how much longer I can hold off the vote, my friends. More and more star systems are joining the separatists.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: If they do break away -

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: No! I will not let that happen!

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: But if they do, you must realise there aren't enough Jedi to protect the Republic. We are keepers of the peace, not soldiers.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Master Yoda, do you think it will really come to war?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Worse than war, I fear... Much worse.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: What do you sense, Master?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Impossible to see ... The Dark Side clouds everything. But this I am sure of -  Do their duty the Jedi will.

Speaker: dar wac
Dialogue: The loyalist committee has arrived, my Lord.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Send them in.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: With you the force is strong... young Senator. To see you alive brings warm feeling to my heart.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Thank you, Master Yoda. Do you have any idea who was behind the attack?

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Our intelligence points to disgruntled spice miners, on the moons of Naboo.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I don't wish to disagree but I think that Count Dooku was behind it.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: You know, M'Lady, Count Dooku was once a Jedi. He wouldn't assassinate anyone, it is not in his character.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: In dark times nothing is what it appears to be, but the fact remains Senator, in grave danger you are.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Count Dooku has always avoided any kind of conflict. It appears he has no desire to start a war. Why would he kill you? To what end?

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Master Jedi, may I suggest that the Senator be placed under the protection of your graces.

Speaker: bail organa
Dialogue: Do you think that is a wise use of manpower during these stressful times?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Chancellor, if I may comment, I do not believe the...

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: ..."situation is that serious." No, but I do, Senator.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Chancellor, please! I don't want any more guards!

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: I realise all too well that additional security might be disruptive for you, but perhaps someone you are familiar with... an old friend like... Master Kenobi...

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: That's possible. He has just returned from a Border dispute on Ansion.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: You must remember him, M'Lady... he watched over you during the blockade conflict.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: This is not necessary, Chancellor.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Do it for me, M'Lady, please. I will rest easier. We had a big scare today. The thought of losing you is unbearable.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: I will have Obi-Wan report to you immediately, M'Lady.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Too little about yourself you worry, Senator, and too much about politics. Be mindful of your danger, Padm. Accept our help.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: I will not like this Republiv, that has stood for over a thousand years, be split in two

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Obi! Obi! Obi! Mesa sooo smilen to see'en yousa. Wahoooooo!

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Oops! Wheresa mesa manners? Excuse me, Master Obi-Wan. I completely forgot myself for a moment there. I have had to learn Diplodiaclect... speak it like a native now. Don't really see the point, actually, but members of the Senate seem to prefer it...

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Nooooooo! Yousa so biggen! Yiyiyiyyi! Annie!! Mesa no believen.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Hi, Jar Jar.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Annie! Annie! Yiyiyiyiyiyiiii!

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Lookie... lookie... Oops!... Oh, dear, I'm afraid I've forgotten myself again.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: It has been far too long Master Kenobi. I'm so glad our paths have crossed again... but I must warn you that I think your presence here is unnecessary.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Annie??  My goodness you've grown.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: So have you... grown more beautiful, I mean... and much shorter... for a Senator, I mean.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Oh Annie, you'll always be that little boy I knew on Tatooine.

Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: I am very grateful you are here, Master Kenobi. The situation is more dangerous than the Senator will admit.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I don't need more security, I need answers. I want to know who is trying to kill me.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: We will find out who is trying to kill you Padm, I promise you.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I meant in the interest of protecting her, Master, of course.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Why else do you think we were assigned to her, if not to find the killer? Protection is a job for local security... not Jedi. It's overkill, Master. Investigation is implied in our mandate.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Perhaps with merely your presence, the mysteries surrounding this threat will be revealed.  Now if you will excuse me I will retire.

Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: Well, I know I feel a lot better having you here. I'll have an officer on every floor and I'll be at the command centre downstairs.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: She didn't even recognise me, Jar Jar. I thought about her every day since we parted... and she's forgotten me completely.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Shesa happy. Happier den mesa see-en her in longo time.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Yes, my master.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Why couldn't we see this attack on the Senator?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Masking the future, is this disturbance in the Force.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: The propecy is coming true, the Dark Side is growing.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: And only those who have turned to the Dark Side can sense the possibilities of the future. Only going through the Dark Side can we see.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: It's been ten years, and the Sith still have no shown themselves. Do you think they are behind this?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: ...Out there, they are. A certainty that is.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Do you think Obi-Wan's apprentice will be able to bring balance to the Force?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Only if he chooses to follow his destiny.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Quiet as a tomb. I don't like just waiting here for something to happen to her.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: She covered that camera. I don't think she liked me watching her.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: She programmed Artoo to warn us if there's an intruder.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I know, but we also want to catch this assassin. Don't we, Master?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It was her idea... No harm will come to her. I can sense everything going on in that room. Trust me.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: And yours are?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I don't sleep well, anymore.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I don't know why I keep dreaming About her now. I haven't seen her since I was little.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'd rather dream of Padm. Just Being around her again is... intoxicating.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Not another lecture, Master. Not on the economics of politics.... It's too early in the morning... and besides, you're generalising. The Chancellor doesn't appear to be corrupt.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I think he is a good man. My instincts are very positive about...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Stay here!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: That was wacky! I almost lost you in the traffic.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Oh, you know, Master, I couldn't find a speeder I really liked, with an open cockpit... and with the right speed capabilities... and then you know I had to get a really gonzo color...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I thought I already did.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, I forgot you don't like flying, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Master, you know I've been flying since before I could walk. I'm very good at this.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, Master. Don't worry, this guy's gonna kill himself any minute now!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Right - this isn't working.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Clear that!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Clear the flag! We're losing power! Hurry!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: So sorry, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, Master!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: That was crazy!!!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Ahh, damn.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No, we can make it.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: But it worked... we made it.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I think we're still alive.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I could have made it...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No we didnt...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: This is a shortcut... I think.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Master, if we keep this chase going, that creeps gonna end up deep fried. Personally, Id very much like to find out who in the hell he is and who hes working for...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Im deeply sorry, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Excuse me for a moment.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: She went into that club, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Yes, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I know, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I've heard this lesson before...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I try, Master.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Don't say that Master... You're the closest thing I have to a father... I love you. I don't want to cause you pain.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I will. I'll do better, I promise.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I think he's a she...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Where are you going, Master?

Speaker: elan sleazebaggano
Dialogue: Wanna buy some death sticks?

Speaker: elan
Dialogue: I don't want to sell you death- sticks.

Speaker: elan
Dialogue: I want to go home and rethink my life.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Easy... Official business. Go back to your drinks.

Speaker: zam wessel
Dialogue: The Senator from Naboo.

Speaker: zam wessel
Dialogue: It was just a job.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Tell us!

Speaker: zam wessel
Dialogue: That Senator's gonna die soon anyway, and the next one won't make the same mistake I did...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Who hired you? Tell us... tell us now!

Speaker: zam
Dialogue: It was a Bounty Hunter called...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Representative Binks. I know I can count on you.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Yousa betchen mesa bottums.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: It is not every day that I am called upon to...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You're a good friend, Jar Jar. I don't wish to hold you up. I'm sure you have a great deal to do.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Of course, M'lady.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I do not like this idea of hiding.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Don't worry. Now that the Council has ordered an investigation, it won't take Master Obi-Wan long to find that bounty hunter.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I haven't worked for a year to defeat the "Military Creation Act" not to be here when its fate is decided.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sometimes we have to let go of our pride and do what is requested of us.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Pride?!? Annie, you're young, and you don't have a very firm grip on politics. I suggest you reserve your opinions for some other time.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, M'lady. I was only trying to...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Annie! No!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Please don't call me that.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Annie...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I've always called you that... it is your name, isn't it?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It's Anakin. When you say Annie it's like I'm still a little boy... and I'm not.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Anakin. It's impossible to deny you've...  ...that you've grown up.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Master Obi-Wan manages not to see it...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Mentors have a way of seeing more of our faults than we would like. It's the only way we grow.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Don't get me wrong... Obi-Wan is a great mentor. As wise as Master Yoda and as powerful as Master Windu. I am truly thankful to be his apprentice. Only... although I'm a Padawan learner, in some ways... a lot of ways... I'm ahead of him. I'm ready for the trials. I know I am! He knows it too. He believes I'm too unpredictable... Other Jedi my age have gone through the trials and made it... I know I started my training late... but he won't let me move on.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: That must be frustrating.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It's worse... he's overly critical. He never listens! He just doesn't understand! It's not fair!

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I'm sorry... You sounded exactly like that little boy I once knew, when he didn't get his way.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm not whining! I'm not.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I didn't say it to hurt you.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I know...

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Anakin...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Don't try to grow up too fast.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I am grown up. You said it yourself.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Please don't look at me like that.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Because I can see what you're thinking.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Ahh... so, you have Jedi powers too?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: It makes me feel uncomfortable.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, M'lady.

Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: Be safe, m'lady.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Thank you, Captain. Take good care of Dorme... the threat's on you two now.

Speaker: dorme
Dialogue: He'll be safe with me.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You'll be fine.

Speaker: dorme
Dialogue: It's not me, M'Lady. I worry about you. What if they realise I'm not you?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Then my Jedi protector will have to prove how grown up he is.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Yes, Master.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I will be most grateful for your speed, Master Jedi.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Time to go.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: May the Force be with you, Master.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Suddenly, I'm afraid...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm kinda scared too. This is my first assignment on my own.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: There's nothing to worry about... we have Artoo with us.

Speaker: captain typho
Dialogue: I'd be more concerned about her doing something, than him.

Speaker: server
Dialogue: Keep moving! Keep moving!

Speaker: food server
Dialogue: Hey! No Droids!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No, no, Mom, no...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You seemed to be having a nightmare.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Are you hungry?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: We went into lightspeed a while ago.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I look forward to seeing Naboo again. I've thought about it every day since I left. It's by far the most beautiful place I've ever seen...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You were just a little boy then. It may not be as you remember it; time changes your perception.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I think time has given me much more mature feelings to enhance my perception.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: It must be difficult having sworn your life to the Jedi... not being able to visit the places you like... or do the things you like...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Or be with the people I love.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Are you allowed to love? I thought that was forbidden for a Jedi.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Attachment is forbidden. Possession is forbidden. Compassion, which I would define as unconditional love, is central to a Jedi's life, so you might say we're encouraged to love.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You have changed so much

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You haven't changed a bit. You're exactly the way I remember you in my dreams. I doubt if Naboo has changed much either.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: It hasn't...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I can't wait to breathe the sweet breeze that comes off the rolling hills. Whenever I try to visualise the Force, those hills are what I see.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I love Naboo.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Were you dreaming about you mother earlier, weren't you?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Yes... I left Tatooine so long ago, my memory of her is fading. I don't want to lose it. Recently I've been seeing her in my dreams... vivid dreams... scary dreams. I worry about her.

Speaker: hermione
Dialogue: Can I help ya?

Speaker: hermione bagwa
Dialogue: Waddya want him for?

Speaker: hermione bagwa
Dialogue: Someone to see ya, honey  A Jedi, by the looks of him.

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: Obi-Wan!

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: Take a seat! Be right with ya!

Speaker: hermione bagwa
Dialogue: You want a cup of ardees?

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: Hey, ol' buddy!

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: So, my friend. What can I do for ya?

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: Well, whattaya know...

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: I ain't seen one of these since I was prospecting on Subterrel beyond the Outer Rim!

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: This baby belongs to them cloners. What you got here is a Kamino Kyberdart.

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: It's these funny little cuts on the side give it away... Those analysis droids you've got over there only focus on symbols, you know. I should think you Jedi would have more respect for the difference between knowledge and wisdom.

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: No, it's beyond the Outer Rim. I'd say about twelve parsecs outside the Rishi Maze, toward the south. It should be easy to find, even for those droids in your archive to find. Those Kaminoans keep to themselves. They're cloners. Damned good ones, too.

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: It depends.

Speaker: dexter jettster
Dialogue: On how good your manners are... and how big your pocketbook is...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: If I grew up here, I don't think I'd ever leave.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I doubt that.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No, really. When I started my training, I was very homesick and very lonely. This city and my Mom were the only pleasant things I had to think about... The problem was, the more I thought about my Mom, the worse I felt. But I would feel better if I thought about the palace - the way it shimmers in the sunlight - the way the air always smells of flowers...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: ...and the soft sound of the distant waterfalls. The first time I saw the Capital, I was very young... I'd never seen a waterfall before. I though they were so beautiful... I never dreamed one day I'd live in the palace.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Well, tell me, did you dream of power and politics when you were a little girl?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: No! That was the last thing I thought of. My dream was to help in the "Refugee Relief Movement." I never thought of running for elected office. But the more history I studied, the more I realised how much good politicians could do. So when I was eight, I joined the "Apprentice Legislators", then later on became a Senatorial advisor, with such a passion that, before I knew it, I was elected Queen. Partly because I scored so high on my education certificate, but for the most part it was my conviction that reform was possible. I wasn't the youngest Queen ever elected, but now that I think back on it, I'm not sure I was old enough. I'm not sure I was ready.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: The people you served thought you did a good job. I heard they tried to amend the Constitution so you could stay in office.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Popular rule is not democracy, Annie. It gives the people what they want, not what they need. And, truthfully, I was relieved when my two terms were up. So were my parents. They worried About me during the blockade and couldn't wait for it all to be over. Actually, I was hoping to have a family by now... My sisters have the most amazing, wonderful kids... but when the Queen asked me to serve as Senator, I couldn't refuse her.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I agree! I think the Republic needs you... I'm glad you chose to serve. I feel things are going to happen in our generation that will change the galaxy in profound ways.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I think so too.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: We've been worried about you.  I'm so glad you're safe, Padm.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Thank you, Your Highness. I only Wish I could have served you better by staying on Coruscant for the vote.

Speaker: sio bibble
Dialogue: Given the circumstances, Senator, you know it was the only decision Her Highness could have made.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: How many systems have joined Count Dooku and the separatists?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: About two hundred. And more are leaving the Republic every day. If the Senate votes to create an army, I'm sure it's going to push us into a civil war.

Speaker: sio bibble
Dialogue: It's unthinkable! There hasn't been a full-scale war since the formation of the Republic!

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: Do you see any way, through negotiations, to bring the separatists back into the Republic?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Not if they feel threatened. The separatists don't have an army, but if they are provoked, they will move to defend themselves. I'm sure of that. And with no time or money to build an army, my guess is they will turn to the Commerce Guilds or the Trade Federation for help.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: The armies of commerce! Why has Nothing been done in the Senate to restrain them?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I'm afraid that, despite the Chancellor's best efforts, there are still many bureaucrats, judges, and even Senators on the payrolls of the Guilds.

Speaker: sio bibble
Dialogue: It's outrageous! After all of those hearings, and the four trials in the Supreme Court, Nute Gunray is still the Viceroy of the Trade Federation. Do those money mongers control everything?

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: Remember, Counsellor, the courts were able to reduce the Federation's armies. That's a move in the right direction.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: There are rumours, Your Highness, that the Federation Army was not reduced as they were ordered.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: The Jedi have not been allowed to investigate. It would be to be too dangerous for the economy, we were told.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: We must keep our faith in the Republic. The day we stop believing democracy can work is the day we lose it.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Let's pray that day never comes.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: In the meantime, we must consider your own safety.

Speaker: sio bibble
Dialogue: What is your suggestion, Master Jedi?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Anakin's not a Jedi yet, Counsellor. He's still a Padawan learner. I was thinking...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Hey, hold on a minute!

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Excuse me! I was thinking I would stay in the Lake Country. There are some places up there that are very isolated.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Excuse me?! I am in charge of security here, M'Lady.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Annie, my life is at risk, and this is my home. I know it very well... that is why we're here. I think it would be wise for you to take advantage of my knowledge in this instance.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sorry, M'Lady.

Speaker: sio bibble
Dialogue: She is right. The Lake Country is the most remote part of Naboo. Not many people and a clear view of the surrounding terrain.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: Perfect. It's settled then.

Speaker: queen jamillia
Dialogue: Padm, I had an audience with your father yesterday. I told him what was happening. He hopes you will visit your mother before you leave... your family's very worried about you.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Did you call for assistance?

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: He has a powerful face, doesn't he? He was one of the most brilliant Jedi I have had the privilege of knowing.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: The Lost Twenty... and Count Dooku was the most recent and the most painful. No one likes to talk about it. His leaving was a great loss to the Order.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Well, one might say, he was always a bit out of step with the decisions of the Council... much like your old Master, Qui-Gon Jinn.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Oh, yes. They were alike in many ways. Very individual thinkers... idealists...

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: (continuing He was always striving to become a more powerful Jedi. He wanted to be the best. With a lightsaber, in the old style of fencing, he had no match. His knowledge of the Force was... unique. In the end, I think he left because he lost faith in the Republic. He believed that politics were corrupt, and he felt the Jedi betrayed themselves by serving the politicians. He always had very high expectations of government. He disappeared for nine or ten years, then he just showed up recently as the head of the separatist movement.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Well, I'm sure you didn't call me over here for a history lesson. Are you having a problem, Master Kenobi?

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Kamino? It's not a system I'M familiar with... Let me see...

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Are you sure you have the right co-ordinates?

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: No co-ordinates? It sounds like the kind of directions you'd get from a street tout... some old miner or Furbog trader.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Are you sure it exists?

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: Let me do a gravitational scan.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: There are some inconsistencies here. Maybe the planet you're looking for was destroyed.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: It ought to be. Unless it was very recent.  I hate to say it, but it looks like the system you're searching for doesn't exist.

Speaker: jocasta nu
Dialogue: The archives are comprehensive and totally secure, my young Jedi. One thing you may be absolutely sure of - if an item does not appear in our records, it does not exist!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: There's my house!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: What? Don't say you're shy!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No, but I...

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Ryoo!! Pooja!!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I'm so happy to see you! This is Anakin. Anakin, this is Ryoo, and this is Pooja.

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: They're eating over at Jev Narran's later, Mom. They just had a snack. They'll be fine.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Anakin, this is my sister, Sola.

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: Hello, Anakin.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: jobal
Dialogue: You're just in time for dinner. I hope you're hungry, Anakin.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: A little.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: He's being polite, Mom. We're starving.

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: You came to the right place at the right time. Sit down, son.

Speaker: jobal
Dialogue: Honey, it's so good to see you safe. We were so worried.

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: Dear...

Speaker: jobal
Dialogue: I know, I know... but I had to say it. Now it's done.

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: Well, this is exciting! Do you know, Anakin, you're the first boyfriend my sister's ever brought home?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Sola!! He isn't my boyfriend! He's a Jedi assigned by the Senate to protect me.

Speaker: joval
Dialogue: A bodyguard?! Oh, Padme! They didn't tell us it was that serious!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: It's not, Mom, I promise.  Anyway, Anakin's a friend. I've known him for years. Remember that little boy who was with the Jedi during the blockade crisis?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: He grew up.

Speaker: jobal
Dialogue: Honey, when are you going to settle down? Haven't you had enough of that life? I certainly have!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Mom, I'm not in any danger.

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: Is she?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: ...Yes... I'm afraid she is.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: But not much.

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: Sometimes I wish I'd traveled more... but I must say, I'm happy here.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Padme tells me you teach at the university?

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: Yes, and before that, I was a builder. I also worked for the Refugee Relief Movement, when I was very young.

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: Why haven't you told us about him?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: What's there to talk about?  He's just a boy.

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: A boy? Have you seen the way he looks at you?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Sola - stop it!

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: It's obvious he has feelings for you. Are you saying, little baby sister, that you haven't noticed?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I'm not your baby sister, Sola. Anakin and I are friends... our relationship is strictly professional.  Mom, would you tell her to stop it?

Speaker: sola
Dialogue: Well, maybe you haven't noticed the way he looks at you. I think you're afraid to.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Cut it out.

Speaker: jobal
Dialogue: Sola's just concerned... we all are.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Oh, Mom, you're impossible. What I'm doing is important.

Speaker: jobal
Dialogue: You've done your service, Padm. It's time you had a life of your own. You're missing so much!

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: Now tell me, son. How serious is this thing? How much danger is my daughter really in?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: There have been two attempts on her life. Chances are there'll be more. My Master is tracking down the assassins. I'm sure he'll find out who they are. This situation, won't last long.

Speaker: ruwee
Dialogue: I don't want anything to happen to her.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I don't either.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Don't worry, this won't take long.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I just want to get there before dark.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You still live at home.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I move around so much, I've never had a place of my own. Official residences have no warmth. I feel good here. I feel at home.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I never had a real home. Home was always where my Mom was.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Is this you?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: That was when I went with the Relief Group to Shadda-Bi-Boran. Their sun was imploding, and the planet was dying. I was helping to relocate the children. See that little one I'm holding? His name was N'a-kee-tula, which means sweethear. He was so full of life,. All those kids were. I did everything I could to save him, but he died... they all did. They were never able to adapt... to live off their native planet.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: My first day as an Apprentice Legislator. Notice the difference?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Don't think... feel... be as one with the Force. Help you, it will.  Younglings - enough! A visitor we have. Welcome him.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Master Obi-Wan Kenobi, meet the mighty Bear Clan.

Speaker: children
Dialogue: Welcome, Master Obi-Wan!

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: What help to you, can I be?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: An interesting puzzle. Gather round the map reader, younglings. Master Obi-Wan has lost a planet. Find it, we will try...

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Most interesting. Gravitys silhouette remains, but the star and all its planets have disappeared. How can this be?

Speaker: children
Dialogue: Thats right! Yes! Thats what happened! Someone erased it!

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is. Uncluttered. To the centre of the pull of gravity go, and find your planet you will.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Much harder to answer, that question is.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: When I was in Level Three, we used to come here for school retreat. See that island? We used to swim there every day. I love the water.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I do too. I guess it comes from growing up on a desert planet.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: ...We used to lie on the sand and let the sun dry us... and try to guess the names of the birds singing.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I dont like sand. Its coarse and rough and irritating, and it gets everywhere. Not like here. Here everythings soft... and smooth...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: There was a very old man who lived on the island. He used to make glass out of sand - and vases and necklaces out of the glass. They were magical.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Everything here is magical.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You could look into the glass and see the water. The way it ripples and moves. It looked so real... but it wasnt.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sometimes, when you believe something to be real, it becomes real. Real enough, anyway...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I used to think if you looked too deeply into glass, you would lose yourself.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I think it's true...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I shouldn't have done that.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm sorry. When I'm around you, my mind is no longer my own.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: It's the situation... the stress...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: ...the view.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Be wary, this disturbance in the Force is growing stronger.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: The Council is confident in this decision, Obi-Wan.

Speaker: mace
Dialogue: He has exceptional skills. The Council is confident in its decision, Obi-Wan. If the prophecy is true, he weill be the one to bring balance to the Force.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: There's something else?

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Probing the Dark Side is a dangerous process. He could be in seclusion for days... May the force be with you.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You did that?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: That! Now stop it!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Anakin!!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm not really supposed to do that... for fun, I mean. If Master Obi-Wan were here, he'd be very grumpy.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: May I tell you something?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Then how can I tell you?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Maybe you should use your Jedi intuition.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It doesn't work around you. My mind is always a muddle... I can only think of you.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Anakin, don't...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: From the moment I met you, all those years ago, a day hasn't gone by when I haven't thought of you. And now that I'm close to you again, I'm in agony. The closer I get to you, the worse it gets. The thought of not being with you mskes my stomach turn over - my mouth goes dry. I feel dizzy. I can't breathe. I'm haunted by the kiss you should never have given me. My heart is beating, hoping that kiss will not become a scar. You are in my very soul, tormenting me. What can I do? I will do anything you ask...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: If you are suffering as much as I am, tell me.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: ...I can't. We can't. It's just not possible.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Anything's possible. Padme, please listen...

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You listen. We live in a real world. Come back to it. You're studying to become a Jedi Knight. I'm a Senator. If you follow your thoughts through to conclusion, they will take us to a place we cannot go... regardless of the way we feel about each other.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Then you do feel something! There's an extraordinary connection between us. You can't deny that.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Annie, it doesn't make any difference. Jedi aren't allowed to marry. You swore an oath, remember? You'd be expelled from the Order. I will not let you give up your responsibilities... your future, for me.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I was destined to be a Jedi. I don't think I could be anything else. But you are asking me to be rational. That is something I know I cannot do. I wish I could wish my feelings away... but I can't.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I am not going to give into this. I'm not going to throw my life away. I have more important things to do than fall in love.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It wouldn't have to be that way... we could keep it a secret.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Then we'd be living a lie - one we couldn't keep even if we wanted to. Mt sister saw it. So did my mother. I couldn't do that. Could you, Anakin? Could you live like that?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: ...No, you're right. It would destroy us.

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: Welcome to Tipoca City, Master Jedi.

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: Everything is ready. The Prime Minister expects you.

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: Of course! He is anxious to see you. After all these years, we were beginning to think you weren't coming. Now please, this way!

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: May I present Lama Su, Prime Minister of Kamino... and this is Master Jedi...

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Please...

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: I trust you are going to enjoy your stay. We are most happy you have arrived at the best part of the season.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: And now to business. You will be delighted to hear we are on schedule. Two hundred thousand units are ready, with another million well on the way.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Please tell your Master Sido-Dyas that we have every confidence his order will be met on time and in full. He is well, I hope?

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Jedi Master Sifo-Dyas. He's still a leading member of the Jedi Council, is he not?

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: You must be anxious to inspect the units for yourself.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sure you do... you just don't want to tell me.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Are you going to use one of your Jedi mind tricks on me?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: They only work on the weak-minded. You are anything but weak-minded.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: All right... his name was Palo. I was twelve. We were both in the Legislative Youth Program. He was a few years older then I... very cute... dark curly hair... dreamy eyes.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: All right, I get the picture... whatever happened to him?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I went on to become a Queen. He went on to become an artist.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Maybe he was the smart one.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You really don't like politicians, do you?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I like two or three, but I'm not really sure about one of them.  I don't think the system works.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: How would you have it work?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: We need a system where the politicians sit down and discuss the problems, agree what's in the best interests of all the people, and then do it.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: That is exactly what we do. The trouble is that people don't wlways agree. In fact, they hardly ever do.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Then they should be made to.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: By whom? Who's going to make them?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I don't know. Someone.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Of course not me.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: But someone.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Someone wise.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: That sounds an awful lot like a dictatorship to me.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Well, if it works...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You're making fun of me.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: On no, I'd be much too frightened to tease a Senator.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You're so bad!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You're always so serious. Always carrying the weight of the universe on your shoulders.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Magnificent, aren't they?

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: We modified their genetic structure to make them less independent than the original host. As a result they are totally obedient, taking any order without question.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: A bounty hunter called Jango Fett. We felt a Jedi would be the perfect choice, but Sido-Dyas hand- picked Jango Fett himself.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Oh, we keep him here. After a few hundred thousand clones, the genetic pattern starts to fade, so we take a fresh supply. He lives here, but he's free to come and go as he pleases.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Apart from his pay, which is considerable, Fett demanded only one thing - an unaltered clone for himself. Curious isn't it?

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Pure genetic replication. No tampering with the structure to make it more docile... and no growth acceleration...

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: I would be most happy to arrange it, for you.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Oh yes, it's essential. Otherwise, a mature clone would take a lifetime to grow. Now, we can do it in half the time. Those items you saw on the parade ground were started ten years ago, when Sido-dyas first placed the order, and they're already mature...

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: About five years ago.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: They're immensely superior to droids, capable of independent thought and action.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: I'd hoped you would be pleased.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Himself? Of course not. This army is for the Republic?

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: We are also very much agasint this Count Dooku and his seccessionist movement. We are proud to be of help to the Republic.

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: I have arranged for you to meet Jango Fett in the morning. Sleep well.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: No. Whoever placed that order was not a Jedi, I can assure you.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Who he is working for... discover that, you must.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Inform the chancellor of this, we must.

Speaker: windu
Dialogue: Who do you think this impostor Sido-Dyas, could be?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No...No...No...Mom!...Don't, no, don't!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Don't go.

Speaker: pamde
Dialogue: I don't want to disturb you.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Your presence is soothing.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You had a nightmare again last night.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Jedi don't have nightmares.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I heard you.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I saw my mother. I saw her as clearly as I see you now. She's suffering, Padme. She is in pain...They're killing her!  I know I'm disobeying my mandate to protect you, Senator. I know I will be punished and possibly thrown out of the Jedi Order, but I must go. I have to help her! I'm sorry, Padme. I don't have a choice.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Annie, I told you I wouldn't let you give up your future for me. I'll go with you. That way you can continue to protect me, and you won't be disobeying your mandate.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: What about Master Obi-wan?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I guess we won't tell him, will we?

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: Boba, is your father here?

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: May we see him?

Speaker: boba fett
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: boba fett
Dialogue: Dad! Taun We's here!

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: Welcome back, Jango. Was your trip productive?

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: Fairly.

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: This is Jedi Master, Obi-Wan Kenobi. He's come to check on our progress.

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: That right?

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: I'm just a simple man, trying to make my way in the universe, Master Jedi.

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Once or twice.

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Possibly...

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Boba, close the door.

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Master who?

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Never heard of him. I was recuited by a man called Darth Tyranus on one of the moons of Bogden.

Speaker: taun we
Dialogue: Sido-Dyas told us to expect him. And he showed up just when your Jedi Master said he would. We have kept the Jedis involvement a secret until your arrival, just as your Master requested.

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Do you like your army?

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: They'll do their job well, I'll guarantee that.

Speaker: jango
Dialogue: Always a pleasure to meet a Jedi.

Speaker: boba
Dialogue: What is it, Dad?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Wait, please.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: No, not that one - that one!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Excuse me, Watto.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I said excuse me.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: Shut down.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: What? I don't know you... What can I do for you? You look like a Jedi. Whatever it is... I didn't do it.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Let me help you with that.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm looking for Shmi Skywalker.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: Annie?? Little Annie?? Naaaah!!

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: You are Annie! It is you! You little womp rat.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: You sure sprouted Weehoo! A Jedi! Waddya know? Hey, maybe you couldda help wit some daedbeats who owe...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: My mother...

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Shmi... she's not mine no more. I sold her.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Sold her...

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: Years ago. Sorry, Anne, but you know, business is business. Sold her to a moisture farmer named Lars. Least I think it was Lars. Believe it or not, I heard he freed her and married her. Can ya beat that?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Do you know where they are?

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: Long way from here... someplace over on the other side of Mos Eisley, I think...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'd like to know.

Speaker: watto
Dialogue: Yeah... sure... absolutely. Let's go look in my records.

Speaker: lama su
Dialogue: Tell your Council the first battalions are ready. And remind them that if they need more troops, we will need time to grow them.

Speaker: boba fett
Dialogue: Dad!!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Stay with the ship, Artoo.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Threepio?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Hello, Threepio.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I've come to see my mother.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Threepio, what's happened?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm Anakin Skywalker. I'm here looking for my mother.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Owen Lars... I guess I'm your step-brother.  This is my girlfriend, Beru.

Speaker: beru
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I'm Padme.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: I had a feeling you might show up some day.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Is my mother here?

Speaker: cliegg
Dialogue: No, she's not.

Speaker: cliegg
Dialogue: Cliegg Lars. Shmi is my wife... Come on inside. We have a lot to talk about.

Speaker: cliegg
Dialogue: Your mother had gone out early, like she always did, to pick mushrooms that grow on the vaporatos. From the tracks, she was about halfway when they took her. Those Tuskens walk like men, but they're vicious, mindless monsters. Thirty of us went out after her. Four of us came back. Three more are still out there looking. I'd be with them, only... I just couldn't ride any more... until I heal.

Speaker: cliegg
Dialogue: This isn't the way I wanted to meet you, son. This isn't how your mother and I planned it. I don't want to give up on her, but she's been gone a month. There's little hope she's lasted this long.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: To find my mother.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: No, Annie!

Speaker: cliegg
Dialogue: She's daed, son. Accept it.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I can feel her pain, and I will find her. I know she's alive.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You are going to have to stay here. These are good people, Padme. You'll be safe.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Take my speeder bike.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Anakin...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I trust you'll watch over her, Owen.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Don't worry.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I won't be long.

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: Nearly there, son.

Speaker: boba fett
Dialogue: Dad, look!!

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: Hang on!

Speaker: boba fett
Dialogue: Dad! Watch out!

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: Stay calm, son. We'll be fine. That Jedi won't be able to follow us through this.

Speaker: boba fett
Dialogue: Got him! Yeahhhhh!

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: We won't see him again.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I'm not leaving, Threepio. I just can't sleep.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I guess you're lucky.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You're not happy here?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Being like what?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I guess I wouldn't like it at all.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Maybe we can do something about it.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Why not? They seem to have a box of old coverings here.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Let's see, if we put this... here...

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: You'll have to be quiet, Threepio. Hold still, please.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Mom... Mom... Mom...

Speaker: shmi
Dialogue: Annie...? Is it you?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Im here, Mom. Youre safe. Hang on. Im going to get you out of here...

Speaker: shmi
Dialogue: Im so glad... to see you, Annie... Now... I am complete...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Just stay with me, Mom. Im going to make you well again. Everythings going to be fine.

Speaker: shmi
Dialogue: You look so handsome. My son... my grown-up son. Im so proud of you, Annie... so proud... I missed you so much... I love...

Speaker: bail organa
Dialogue: That's outrageous! The treaty forbids the Trade Federation from building up an army. What are they doing?!

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Those Geonosian foundries are part of the Techno Union. We will call in their representatives and ask them a few very pointed questions.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: With the forename Darth, a Sith he must be.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Our missing apprentice. They are playing their hand at last.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Perhaps too many pieces are missing from this puzzle, there are.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Be careful, Obi-Wan. This investigation is becoming less than routine. Do you need help?

Speaker: bail organa
Dialogue: The Commerce Guilds are preparing for war... there can be no doubt of that.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Count Dooku must have made a treaty with them.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: We must stop them soon before they're fully ready.

Speaker: bail organa
Dialogue: Unfortunately, the debate is not over. The Senate will never be able to approve the use of that army before the separatists attack.

Speaker: mas amedda
Dialogue: This is a crisis! If the Senate votes the Chancellor emergency powers, he could approve the use of the army in a minute.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Please, please, I don't wish to have emergency powers. That's too extreme a solution. It's akin to a dictatorship. We must rely on the Jedi. Master Yoda, how many are available to go to Geonosis?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Two Hundred,... less or more.

Speaker: bail organa
Dialogue: With all due respect for the Jedi Order, two hundred will be no match for hundreds of thousands of battle droids.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Patience. We should wait for Obi- Wan to report back. We don't know that Count Dooku has made a treaty with the Corporate Alliance, it's speculation.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: Out of the question, Senator! You and I are too closely aligned. The issue will become partisan and debates will begin. The proposal must come from a neutral source.

Speaker: mas amedda
Dialogue: If only Senator Amidala were here.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Supreme Chancellor... my august colleagues, I would be proud to propose the motion in question. This is a grave situation, and I'm sure Senator Amidala, and the Queen of Naboo would agree.

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: If called upon, I will serve. But it will be the saddest day of my life.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Great! You look perfect.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Well, Padme, I think he should be yours from now on... I know that is what my Mom would want.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm going after him!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: I thought the first thing he said was to retransmit his message to Coruscant.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Yeah, you're right, you're right.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: We will deal with Count Dooku. The most important thing for you, Anakin, is to stay where you are. Protect the Senator at all costs. That is your priority.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Understood, Master.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: They'll never get there in time to save him. They have to come half way across the galaxy. Look, Geonosis is less than a parsec away.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: If he's still alive.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Annie, are you just going to sit here and let him die?? He's your friend... your mentor...

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: ...He's like my father, but you heard Master Windu. He gave me strict orders to stay here.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: He gave you strict orders to protect me...

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: ...and I'm going to save Obi-Wan. So if you plan to protect me, you will have to come along.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: The longer we wait, the stronger Dooku's armies become. We cannot wait for the Senate to make up its mind about granting the Chancellor emergency powers, in order to be able to use that clone army... We have the authority to go now. We must go now.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Agreed, Master Windu. Two hundred Jedi send. Enough, let's hope they are.

Speaker: mas amedda
Dialogue: Order! Order!!

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: In the regrettable absence of Senator Amidala, the chair recognises Senior Representative of Naboo, Jar Jar Binks.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Senators, dellow felagates...

Speaker: mas amedda
Dialogue: Order! The Senate will accord the Representative the courtesy of a hearing!

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: In response to the direct threat to the Republic from the Confederacy of Independent Systems, I propose that the Senate gives immediate emergency powers to the Supreme Chancellor.

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: Who can deny these are exceptional times? Exceptional times demand exceptional measures! Exceptional measures demand exceptional men!

Speaker: jar jar
Dialogue: That is the sentiment every one of us agrees with! And when the shadow of war has dispersed and the bright day of liberty has dawned once again, the power we now give to the Supreme Chancellor will be gladly, and swiftly returned. Out ancient liberties will be restored to us, burnished even more brightly than before!

Speaker: palpatine
Dialogue: It is with great reluctance that I have agreed to this calling. I love democracy... I love the Republic. The fact that this crisis is demanding I be given absolute power to tule over you is evident. But I am mild by nature and have no desire to destroy the democratic process. The power you give me I will lay down when this crisis has abated, I promise you. And all I ask in return is when my current term of office is over, you allow me to reture and live out my life in peace.

Speaker: mas amedda
Dialogue: We shall proceed to the vote. All those in favor of granting emergency powers to the Supreme Chancellor, signal ate at this time... those opposed?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Hey, where are you going?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: To find Obi-Wan.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No! You're not!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Let go of me!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm not letting you go out there. It's too dangerous.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: What?!?

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It's my job to protect you. I said it's too dangerous. You're not going, and that's final!

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Don't you give me orders, Annie! I'm a Senator of the Galactic Republic. You have no authority to contain me, restrain me, or direct me! You remember your place, young man.  Now you can come along and protect me or stay here. It's up to you.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: It's empty!

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Senator Amidala, I've heard so much about you.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Count Dooku, I assume.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: I'm delighted to meet you at last. We have a great deal to discuss, Senator. I hope you can keep your young Jedi under control.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Don't worry he's housebroken.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You are holding a Jedi Knight, Obi- Wan Kenobi. I am formally requesting you turn him over to me, now.

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: He has been convicted of espionage, Senator, and will be executed. In just a few hours, I believe.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: He is an officer of the Republic. You can't do that.

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: We don't recognise the Republic here, Senator. But if Naboo were to join our Alliance, I could easily hear your plea for clemency.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: And if I don't join your rebellion, I assume this Jedi with me will also die?

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: I don't wish to make you to join our cause against your will, Senator, but you are a rational, honest representative of your people and I assume you want to do what's in their best interest. Aren't you fed up with the corruption, the bureaucrats, the hypocrisy of it all?.. Aren't you? Be honest, Senator.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: The ideals are still alive, Count, even if the institution is failing.

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: You believe in the same ideals we believe in! The same ideals we are striving to make prominent.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: If what you say is true, you should stay in the Republic and help Chancellor Palpatine put things right.

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: The Chancellor means well, M'Lady but he is incompetent. He has promised to cut the bureaucracy, but the bureaucrats are stronger than ever, no? Senator, the Republic cannot be fixed. It is time to start over. The democratic process in the Republic is a sham, a shell game played on the voters. It will not be long before the cult of greed, called the Republic, will lose even the pretext of democracy and freedom.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I cannot believe that. I will not forsake all I have honoured and worked for and betray the Republic. I know of your treaties with the Trade Federation, the Commerce Guilds, and the others, Count. What is happening here is not government that has been bought out by business... it's business becoming government!

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: Are you willing to betray your Jedi friends? Without your co-operation I can do nothing to stop their execution.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: What is to happen to me? Am I to be executed also?

Speaker: dooku
Dialogue: I wouldn't think of such an offence. But, there are individuals who have a strong interest in your demise, M'lady. It has nothing to do with politics, I'm afraid. It's purely personal, and they have already paid great sums to have you assassinated. I'm sure they will push hard to have you included in the executions. I'm sorry but if you are not going to co-operate, I must turn you over to the Geonosians for justice. I've done all I can for you.

Speaker: jango fett
Dialogue: I'll take that weapon.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Anakin...

Speaker: sun rit
Dialogue: You have been charged and found guilty of Espionage.

Speaker: poggle
Dialogue: Do you have anything to say before your sentence is carried out?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: You are committing an act of war, Archduke. I hope you are prepared for the consequences.

Speaker: poggle
Dialogue: We build weapons, Senator... that is our business! Of course we're prepared!

Speaker: nute gunray
Dialogue: Get on with it. Carry out the sentence. I want to see her suffer.

Speaker: poggle
Dialogue: Your other Jedi friend is waiting for you, Senator. Take them to the arena!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Don't be afraid.

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I'm not afraid to die. I've been dying a little bit each day since you came back into my life.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You love me?! I thought we decided not to fall in love. That we would be forced to live a lie. That it would destroy our lives...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: I think our lives are about to be destroyed anyway. My love for you is a puzzle, Annie, for which I have no answers. I can't control it... and now I don't care. I truly, deeply love you, and before we die I want you to know.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I have no desire to be cured of this love either. Long or short, I vow to spend the rest of my life with you.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I retransmitted it as you requested, Master. Then we decided to come and rescue you.

Speaker: sun rit
Dialogue: The felons before you have been convicted of espionage against the Sovereign System of Geonosis. Their sentence of death is to be carried out in this public arena henceforth.

Speaker: poggle
Dialogue: Let the executions begin!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I have a bad feeling about this.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: What about Padme?

Speaker: nute gunray
Dialogue: Foul!! She can't do that... shoot her or something!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Sure! Well, sort of.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Jump!!!

Speaker: nute gunray
Dialogue: This isn't how it's supposed to be! Jango, finish her off.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Patiece, Viceroy... she will die. Maybe this is the way it's supposed to end.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Master Windu, how pleasant of you to join us. You're just in time for the moment of truth. I would think these two new boys of yours could use a little more training.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Sorry to disappoint you, Dooku. This party's over.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Brave, but stupid, my old Jedi friend. You're impossibly outnumbered.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: I don't think so. One Jedi has to be worth a hundred Geonosians.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: It wasn't the Geonosians I was thinking about. How well do you think one Jedi will hold up against a thousand battle droids?

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Don't worry! It's being - taken care of!

Speaker: plo koon
Dialogue: We've done it! Now we have a chance!

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Master Windu!

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Surrender - and your lives will be spared.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: We will not be hostages for you to barter with Dooku.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Then, I'm sorry, old friend. You will have to be destroyed.

Speaker: padme
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Come on - hurry! Hurry!

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: More battalions to the left. Encircle them we must, then divide.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: It's Dooku, go after him!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Padme!!!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Put the ship down! Down!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: No we're not!! Land this ship!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I don't care!.. Go back.

Speaker: droid captain
Dialogue: Your Excellency!

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: That won't be necessary, Captain. Stand down. And leave them to me.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm taking him now!

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: You'll pay for all the Jedi you've killed today, Dooku.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Kenobi, isn't it? As you can see, my Jedi powers are far beyond yours. Now, back down.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Ah, but if I must.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: I have spent the last ten years learning to use the power of the Dark Side. It gives me infinitely greater power.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Grand Master Kenobi, you disappoint me. Yoda holds you in such high esteem.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Which is it?

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: come, come, Master Kenobi. Put me out of my misery.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: That's brave of you, boy - but foolish. I would have thought you'd have learnt your lesson.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: I'm a slow learner.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: You have unusual powers, young Padawan. But not enought to save you this time.

Speaker: anakin
Dialogue: Don't bet on it!

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: Master Yoda. At last we shall know who is the most powerful.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Count Dooku. No interest in contests, do I have.

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: The end for you, Count, this is.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: ...Not yet...

Speaker: padm
Dialogue: Anakin!

Speaker: clone captain
Dialogue: Resistance is at an end, General. What are your orders ?

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: The Force is with us, my Master.

Speaker: darth sidious
Dialogue: Welcome home, Lord Tyranus. You have done well.

Speaker: count dooku
Dialogue: I bring you good news, my Lord. The war has begun.

Speaker: darth sidious
Dialogue: Excellent.  Everything is going as planned.

Speaker: mace windu
Dialogue: Where is your apprentice?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Victory? Victory, you say?

Speaker: yoda
Dialogue: Not victory, a defeat, it was... Master Obi-Wan. Begun, the Clone War has!
